Belarusian opposition leader says Navalny 'murder' a green light for activist killingsExiled Belarusian opposition leader Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya warned on Monday that the death of Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny in a Russian penal colony could send a "green light" for authoritarian countries to kill other political prisoners. Mon, 26 Feb 2024 15:19:02 GMT Y2QB4ZO3PNIRZA2V3JCGJ6XP54 https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/belarusian-opposition-leader-says-navalny-murder-green-light-activist-killings-2024-02-26/Gabrielle Tétrault-Farber世界欧洲
Set designer lodges sexual assault complaint against Gerard Depardieu, lawyer saysA formal complaint of sexual harassment and sexual assault has been lodged against Gerard Depardieu by a crew member of a film they worked on together, the complainant's lawyer said, in the latest in a string of allegations against the French actor. Mon, 26 Feb 2024 15:14:30 GMT UBPC5GRTC5JDHIAWUGW2LUIZZ4 https://www.reuters.com/lifestyle/set-designer-lodges- Sex-assault-complaint-against-gerard-depardieu-lawyer-2024-02-26/Reuters生活方式
UN chief deplores 'paralysis and deadlock' at global disarmament bodyU.N. Secretary General Antonio Guterres told the world's top disarmament negotiating body on Monday it needed to make urgent reforms, accusing it of "paralysis" and failing to compel countries to cut weapons stockpiles. Mon, 26 Feb 2024 15:14:10 GMT NH3LCOUD2JJUZCVW2UYEWPCAPM https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/un-chief-deplores-parathesis-deadlock-global-disarmament-body-2024-02-26/Reuters世界欧洲
Spain's Socialists tell ex-minister to quit over alleged masks scandalSpain's ruling Socialist Party on Monday gave former Transport Minister Jose Luis Abalos 24 hours to step down as a lawmaker after his assistant was arrested on suspicion of taking payments to facilitate contracts for masks during the COVID pandemic. Bulgaria bans two Russian nationals from entering EUBulgaria has banned two Russian citizens from entering the European Union over their alleged role in a security agency operation in the Balkan country, its state security agency said on Monday. Burundi rebel group kills nine in overnight attack - governmentGunmen from the Red Tabara rebel group killed nine people and injured others in an overnight attack in western Burundi near the border with Democratic Republic of Congo, a government spokesperson told reporters on Monday. Mon, 26 Feb 2024 13:48:38 GMT QYVSSTJ5IJNURETO5BHI4TOBOA https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/burundi-rebel-group-kills-9-overnight-attack-government-2024-02-26/Reuters世界非洲
Spain's ports see goods traffic rise as Red Sea crisis continuesThe volume of goods moving through Spain's top ports rose by as much as 25% in January as attacks on shipping in the Red Sea caused companies to divert Europe-bound vessels around southern Africa instead. Mon, 26 Feb 2024 13:48:18 GMT SDRT4PUXL5L6DAY77SS727YG5Q https://www.reuters.com/markets/spains-ports-see-goods-traffic-rise-red-sea-crisis-continues-2024-02-26/Reuters市场
Ukraine's Zelenskiy urges 'fight' for Crimea after 10 years of occupationUkraine and its international partners must continue fighting to restore Ukrainian control over Crimea, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Monday as Kyiv marked a decade of Russian occupation of the Black Sea peninsula. Mon, 26 Feb 2024 13:36:44 GMT EHXZN2JQH5OVVMKRKCOX5T4XYY https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraines-zelenskiy-urges-fight-crimea-after-10-years-occupation-2024-02-26/Reuters世界欧洲
US airman dies after setting himself on fire outside Israeli embassyA U.S. military service member who had set himself on fire outside the Israeli Embassy in Washington over the weekend, in an apparent act of protest against the war in Gaza, has died, local police said on Monday.
